## Loading data

This dataset includes descriptions of hypothetical samples corresponding to 23 species of gilled mushrooms in the Agaricus and Lepiota Family Mushroom drawn from The Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Mushrooms (1981). Each species is identified as definitely edible, definitely poisonous, or of unknown edibility and not recommended. This latter class was combined with the poisonous one. The Guide clearly states that there is no simple rule for determining the edibility of a mushroom.

## Modeling

To create an accurate model for this dataset is rather easy. Because there are specific features that always occur together or individually for the mushroom to be classified as poisonous, a simple tree can be used to classify. Because of this, RandomForestClassifier from Scikit-Learn is used as the framework of choice.

# Poisonous mushroom detection

This project is based on data from UCI Machine Learning. It is a very simple project, trying to classify poisonous from non-poisonous mushroom by phenotype and other characteristics.
